textBox.richText: Cyber Security Research and Development Center The Cyber Security R&D Center was established by the Department of Homeland Security in 2004 to develop security technology for protection of the U.S. cyber infrastructure. The Center conducts its work through partnerships between government and private industry, the venture capital community, and the research community. http://www.cyber.st.dhs.gov/ Trustworthy Cyberspace: Strategic Plan for the Federal Cybersecurity Research and Development Program http://www.cyber.st.dhs.gov/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/Fed_Cybersecurity_RD_Strategic_Plan_2011.pdf Topics for Inducing change: Designed-in Security Tailored Trustworthy Spaces Moving Target Cyber Economic Incentives
